intro: Seetzenia lanata, commonly known as the hairy seetzenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Seetzenia lanata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
